conclusion: To determine moments when speed is 5 m/s, analyze the graph of displacement x as a function of time t.
The graph shows displacement x of a particle as a function of time t.
The slope of the tangent to the curve at any point gives the velocity of the particle at that instant.
Velocity v at any time t is given by the derivative of displacement with respect to time, v = dx/dt.
Velocity at any point on the graph is the slope of the tangent line at that point.
Find points where the absolute value of the slope (speed) is 5 m/s, meaning slope is either 5 m/s or -5 m/s.
At t = 0, the slope is negative and appears steep, but not exactly -5 m/s.
As t increases, the slope becomes less steep until it reaches zero between t = 2 and t = 4.
After t = 2, the slope becomes positive and increases in magnitude.
There are two points where the slope is Â±5 m/s: one before t = 2 with slope -5 m/s, and one after t = 2 with slope 5 m/s.
There are exactly two moments within the time interval from 0 to 4 seconds where the speed is 5 m/s.
